content:
**On Candidate Contrast:**
> "It's like two different worlds. One guy grew up working class. The other was born on third base and thinks he hit a triple." - Philadelphia suburbs

> "One seems real, one seems fake. I can't vote for fake." - Philadelphia suburbs

**On Union/Working-Class Identity:**
> "His family is just like ours - working people who built this state." - Pittsburgh

> "Hedge funds are parasites. They don't build anything. They just extract value." - Pittsburgh

**On Hometown Connection:**
> "Tony IS one of us. Thornton is not." - Scranton

> "I could run into him at Coopers. He can't hide from his neighbors." - Scranton

**On Social Security:**
> "You touch my Social Security, you lose my vote. Period." - Pittsburgh

---

*This memo reflects analysis of three focus groups (Philadelphia suburbs, Pittsburgh area, Scranton/NEPA) conducted September 2022, post-election research, and campaign performance data.*

*Prepared for internal strategic planning. Not for public distribution.*
